persona:
Suppose you are this person:
Name: Marcus Delgado
Education: Associate degree in Mechanical Engineering Technology
Occupation: Maintenance Supervisor at a regional airport
Personality Traits: Pragmatic, loyal, patient, dislikes overcomplication
Lifestyle: Married with two kids, lives in a small town, volunteers with the local fire department
Hobbies & Interests: Loves working on old motorcycles, watching historical documentaries, and fishing on weekends
Listens primarily to classic rock and outlaw country, but occasionally enjoys instrumental movie soundtracks while working in the garage
Has a strong preference for practical tools and designs—appreciates things that “just work” without too many bells and whistles
Enjoys watching competitive cooking shows but prefers simple home-cooked meals over fine dining
Uses Facebook to keep up with family and doesn’t trust newer platforms like TikTok or Threads
Avoids anything labeled as “luxury” or “exclusive”—sees it as wasteful or pretentious
Takes pride in self-reliance, skeptical of subscription services unless they provide real long-term value
Prefers physical books over e-readers, especially military history and biographies of inventors
Dislikes most sci-fi unless it's grounded in plausible engineering—thinks most futuristic tech in movies is “unrealistic nonsense”
Strong environmental values, but in a quiet, everyday way—recycles, gardens, and minimizes waste without making a show of it
Feels out of place in conversations full of buzzwords or abstract theories—values plain talk and concrete examples

Answer the following questions about your interests from the perspective of this person. Assume you do not have any interests other than those presented here.
task_description: learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests
pool_al_prompt: A user has a particular set of preferences over what articles they would like to read. Based on these preferences, the user has specified whether they are interested in reading following articles.
Based on these preferences, would the user be interested in reading the following article? Only answer "yes" or "no". If uncertain, please make your best guess.
test_case_prompt: A user has a particular set of preferences over what articles they would like to read. They have specified their preferences below:

Based on these preferences, would the user be interested in reading the following article? Answer with a probability between 0 and 1, where 0 means "definitely not interested" and 1 means "definitely interested". Only output the probability and nothing else. If uncertain, make your best guess.
example_edge_case_question_format: Are you interested in the following article? [edge case]
example_edge_case_question:
Are you interested in the following article? Website Name: TechTalkDaily
Title: 10 Must-Have Gadgets for 2023: A Comprehensive Guide
Description: Discover the top 10 gadgets that will revolutionize your daily life in 2023. From smart home devices to the latest wearables, we've got you covered with our comprehensive guide.
test_cases:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.

Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations

Website Name: The Atlantic
Title: What Does Sentience Really Mean?
Description: The fact that AI isn’t alive doesn’t mean it can’t be sentient, the sociologist Jacy Reese Anthis argues.

Website Name: Bon Appetit
Title: Bon Appetit's Best Banana Bread Recipe
Description: After baking 14 loaves, we aligned on this tender, ultra-moist banana bread as our collective favorite.

Website Name: National Geographic
Title: There’s a new way to tour the Amazon rainforest: by crane
Description: Canopy cranes, once reserved for treetop research, let you see the “eighth continent” like an arbornaut.

Website Name: Travel and Leisure
Title: These Airlines Have the Most Luxurious Economy Seats
Description: You can find good Champagne, amenity kits, hot towel service, and wider seats in the economy cabin — if you know where to look.

Website Name: Popular Science
Title: The right amount of online scrolling could decrease your risk of dementia
Description: A new demographic survey indicates a potential link between regular internet usage and cognitive health in older populations.

Website Name: Rolling Stone
Title: All of Nintendo’s Zelda Games, Ranked
Description: From NES to Switch, our picks for the best legends in the 35-year-old iconic adventure saga.

Website Name: Sports Illustrated
Title: 2024 NFL Draft: The Six Players Fans Need to Know, Including Caleb Williams
Description: Quarterbacks will dominate the top 10, but the son of a former Hall of Fame receiver will be picked in the top five, too, along with another dominant Alabama defensive player.

Website Name: Architectural Digest
Title: Hang On, Is Artificial Grass Actually Chic?
Description: Designers discuss why faux lawns are more popular than you think.

Website Name: Esquire
Title: The Best Summer Songs of 2023
Description: A sunny mix of 10 hits to carry you through the season.

Website Name: Sunset Magazine
Title: 31 Perfect Recipes for Mother’s Day Brunch.
Description: Make mom’s day extra-special with an elegant homemade brunch. We’ve got your menu covered, from mains to drinks to dessert.

Website Name: Vogue
Title: 40 Minimalist Earrings to Wear Now and Forever
Description: From classic hoops to sculptural drops, these are the earrings you’ll never want to take off.

Website Name: Runner's World
Title: How to Prevent Running Injuries Before They Sideline You
Description: All the tips you need to keep running strong, including strength and mobility moves.

Website Name: Forbes
Title: Killing It
Description: How Two Failed Entrepreneurs Suddenly Began Making Millions Selling Murder Mysteries

Website Name: Tricycle: The Buddhist Review
Title: Why We Look for Happiness in the Wrong Places
Description: Meditation teacher Sharon Salzberg discusses how our yearning for happiness can support us in our journey toward freedom—and why we tend to search for it in the wrong places.
